channel.title: Compile help please?
channel.description:
Can't compile :'( dunno why. I got Java & JDK, i even tried using Lin's environment variable setter, still doesn't work.
HELP?!?!?!?!?!?!!?!?

item.title: Compile help please?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

This is my compiler, much better than the one you have. It compiles the entire src.

@echo off
cd ../src
echo Compiling com.iClarity
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_version here\bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ../bin/ ./com/iClarity/*.java
pause

Save as Build.com.iClarity.bat

Read full topic

item.title: Compile help please?
item.dc:creator: @masterkorv12 masterkorv12
item.description:
@masterkorv12 wrote:

I’d like to thank Ziplock, because his guide helped, thanks alot!

Read full topic

item.title: Compile help please?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“darklom, post:10, topic:323587”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=419995.msg3085217#msg3085217 date=1262459018]

ok, you see where it says “jdk1.6.0_17” change all the “17’s” to your jdk and your all set to go.

It would be much more efficient to just replace the path to your JDK with “javac”.
[/quote]
Not really, I get his problem with every source and I fix it just by changing the jdk version.[/quote]
You wouldn’t have to worry about the version of Java you have if you use javac.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile help please?

ok, you see where it says “jdk1.6.0_17” change all the “17’s” to your jdk and your all set to go.

It would be much more efficient to just replace the path to your JDK with “javac”.[/quote]

item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

darklom:

ok, you see where it says “jdk1.6.0_17” change all the “17’s” to your jdk and your all set to go.

It would be much more efficient to just replace the path to your JDK with “javac”.

item.title: Compile help please?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

masterkorv12:

Yes

You probably do not have the path to your JDK set correctly in your compiler.
Try replacing:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe

With

javac

If you have your environmental variables set correctly, then this should be your solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Compile help please?
item.dc:creator: @masterkorv12 masterkorv12
item.description:
@masterkorv12 wrote:

My compiler:

@echo off
cd …/src

echo Compiling GameEngine
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.event
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/event/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.misc
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/misc/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.npcs
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/npcs/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.npcs.Combat
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/npcs/Combat/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.combat
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/combat/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.Skills
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/Skills/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.Skills.Crafting
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/Skills/Crafting/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.magic
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/magic/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.Minigames
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/Minigames/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.DataFiles
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/DataFiles/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.packetHandler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/packetHandler/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.player.packetHandler.Packets
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/player/packetHandler/Packets/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.world
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/world/*.java

echo Compiling com.iClarity.world.items
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17\bin\javac.exe” -cp . -d …/bin/ ./com/iClarity/world/items/*.java

echo Compiling completed.
exit

Read full topic
